definition: Erlitou (Xia dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 chao2] archaeological site at Yanshi 偃師|偃师[Yan3 shi1] in Luoyang 洛陽|洛阳[Luo4 yang2], Henan)
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The choice of Erlitou Site went through careful consideration.
sentences.chinese: 二里头都城的选址经过了周密的考虑。

sentences.english: At this time, Erlitou Culture displayed a trend of decline and fall.
sentences.chinese: 二里头文化势力在本期呈现的是一种衰亡趋势。

sentences.english: There are many east cultural factors in Erlitou site.
sentences.chinese: 二里头遗址存在着浓厚的东方文化因素。

sentences.english: Dashigu Wall City of Erlitou Culture was discovered in Zhengzhou of the east.
sentences.chinese: 东边的郑州还出现了大师姑二里头文化城址。

sentences.english: The period of Erlitou Culture is the time of the Chinese courtesy formation.
sentences.chinese: 二里头文化时期也是中国礼制体系形成时期。

sentences.english: The congregativeness and pervasion effects of the city caused the quantum jump of Xia civilization.
sentences.chinese: 二里头城市文明的聚集效应和辐射效应。

sentences.english: The later east cultural factors behind the second stage of Erlitou culture come from Yueshi culture.
sentences.chinese: 二里头文化二期以后的东方因素，均来自岳石文化。

sentences.english: There exists a debate as to whether or not Erlitou culture was the site of the Xia dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 存在着争论，不论是二里头文化遗址的夏代。

sentences.english: Erlitou Culture is the culture of Chinese bronze vessel.
sentences.chinese: 二里头文化是中国早期青铜文化。

definition: Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
Yinxu, ruins of Yinshang 殷商 city at Anyang 安陽|安阳 in Henan province, a World Heritage site
Longshan culture/black pottery culture
Qijia neolithic culture, centered around the Gansu Corridor 河西走廊[He2 xi1 Zou3 lang2] c. 2000 BC
townsite
Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
ruins/historic relics
Dawenkou culture (c. 4100-2600 BC), Neolithic culture based in today's Shandong area 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
Liangzhu (c. 3400-2250 BC), neolithic culture of Changjiang delta
to dig up/to appear in an excavation/unearthed/to come up out of the ground
(archeology) grave/tomb
burial area
Banpo neolithic Yangshao culture archaeological site east of Xi'an 西安
archaeology
